tweets.text: Heavy showers are expected across the North West this evening and could lead to surface water and river flooding in some communities. Check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/W9pCLAbyb9

@KarenShackleto5 @SE_Rivers_Trust @theriverstrust @EnvAgency @Thames_RvrsTrst @EpsomEwellBC Would he like to take a holiday in Northumberland? üòâ
I have lots of questions about how sewage fungus can grow  on the surface of land that is a tad waterlogged.

The @EnvAgency are useless example 5,752.

In 2020 the EA set themselves a target of "Enhancing", 2,300km of rivers. A meaningless term much loved by the board.

They achieved 1,753km. So by their measurement they missed a totally made up, completely fatuous objective.

Ho hum. https://t.co/EBi3jF0k68

So @AnglianWater have been breaching their discharge permit on the River Cam since 2015. And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? 

PS. Take chalk water out of a river and replace it with treated sewage guess what? It's no longer a chalk stream, see the Upper Lea as an example. https://t.co/anhHcsCGIB

tweets.text: RT after many problems with the lake we have now been successful in raising ¬£10k for improvements including floating oxygenated islands & duck platforms huge thanks to @AnglingTrust @EnvAgencyNW for funding & @lpoolcouncil our volunteers & anglers working in partnership https://t.co/IJJfwAOsUc
@Theo_Pike @fallonsangler @AnglingTrust Sorry Theo, I was under the impression that it's fine to fish with worm as bait all year round on the Sheaf?

@AgainstSewage @EnvAgency I think it's saying that the sample has to go through the standard procedure to be admissible. We followed these procedures and used the correct lab. It's not something you can just drop in at Boots really.

Ace to be part of a great team effort & a rare treat to be working in the sun today! This has been a super-challeging #nfm build project in a remote location. At times the winter weather threw everything it had at us. Really proud of this project for @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/bEDRgijK6T

Last week we collected water quality data for the Green Lanes Stream and Hogsmill River. The data will give us a better understanding of the health of the watercourses, both of which are regularly impacted by road runoff, misconnected sewers and sewage from nearby storm tanks. https://t.co/IUfGtD7VDQ

urls.title: What do you think of this? - Mark Avery
urls.description: Who doesn‚Äô t love a turtle? asks the headline. Quite a few to judge from the reception this piece got on social media. Two lads planning to make money out of captive breeding reptiles and amphibians and with an ambition to reintroduce herptiles to the UK ‚Äì quite a few of them. When I was their age I didn‚Äô t have this much gumption! All reintroductions need to be carefully thought through of course ‚Äì and there are laws involved too. But the thing that strikes me about this is that it is another of a

tweets.text: @AgainstSewage @SE_Rivers_Trust @theriverstrust @EnvAgency @Thames_RvrsTrst @EpsomEwellBC They are and we do. However, we use an industry standard laboratory to do the work (ALS), so they cannot be discredited.

They can do this by properly funding the @EnvAgency, committing to ending sewage discharges into our rivers, and by not watering down environmental regulations when we so desperately need them.

Watch my full contribution here: https://t.co/a0zwUZpqll

ENDS
@AgainstSewage @SE_Rivers_Trust @theriverstrust @EnvAgency @Thames_RvrsTrst @EpsomEwellBC (It helps when you happen to have an internationally recognised professor of water ecology in your team!)

@wallyhallpark @AnglingTrust @EnvAgencyNW @lpoolcouncil @ManningMr @DanCardenMP @30DaysWild @FieldsInTrust @bloodyromans @Sarah4Clubmoor @Min_FAHD @nwparksforum @LiverpoolParks @ParksCommUK this is amazing - you and your team of volunteers are nothing short of amazing

tweets.text:
Our ocean is getting warmer, and our rivers are getting drier.

We work to protect them against the effects of climate change and to support the survival of many species, like Atlantic salmon.

Read about our plan to address the #ClimateEmergency: https://t.co/s1QHtznLdu

#EA2025 https://t.co/afe7Bwh7RE

urls.title: Cumbria | The Flood Hub
urls.description: This local spaces area will provide information o n our aim to manage flood risk on a catchment scale from Source to Sea. In this section we will introduce you to Cumbria Strategic Flood Partnership, a collective of organisations that coordinates all flood risk management planning and delivery and detailed information on Flood Risk Management Schemes being delivered.

urls.title: Transforming the Trent Valley
urls.description: The Washlands is an extensive piece of natural land that follows the river through to the heart of Burton upon Trent. The vision, informed by consultation with key stakeholders and the local community, addresses how to best balance the regular flooding of the area with the need for public access and recreation, whilst promoting nature conservation and a more environmentally sustainable approach to green space management. Through our natural heritage project, known as Living Floodplains, we will help to

tweets.text: In January we will be carrying out some ground investigations and digging temporary test pits across the #BurtonWashlands. These will provide an insight into the geology of the Washlands informing biodiversity proposals. @EnvAgencyMids @eaststaffsbc Visit https://t.co/JJIcU3M5dy https://t.co/5np02Bhmlw
